intro: Premna leucostoma, commonly known as the white-flowered or white-leaf premna, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Verbenaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine white or silver hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Premna leucostoma is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest flowering display.
